channel.title: Running on YOUR DAILY LIMERICK
channel.description: Recent content in Running on limericks.dailyonthis.site

item.description: A linguist so keen on running Would take off at the break of dawning Her speed was a sight As she flew through the night Away she kept …
There once was an editor named Paul Who ran in a very fast gallop. He moved with such speed It was hard to proceed And soon he was lost in a …
An economist named Ted took a run, The figures and graphs he had to outrun, He ran with a zeal, His notes he could feel, His pace was fast, …
An entrepreneur quite bold Had running for a hobby to hold He’d take morning runs In the blazing sun Eager to increase his wealth fold
A miner was running away with glee, For he knew that his life was key. With a heart full of haste, He fled through the waste, For no one was …
A miner was running with a great haste, His speed was so fast he left no waste. He ran past the rocks, Through tunnels and locks, And then …
A biologist went out for a run, Spinning around, having some fun. Though his legs felt like lead, He kept up his speed, All the way until …
There once was a pharmacist running, Faster than the speed of sound humming. He’d often give chase At a rapid-fire pace When things weren’t …
A botanist who found a new thrill Was running around on a hill. He jumped and he leaped To find the best seed And, so, he found time to …
A counselor by day, at night he did run, Dodging all obstacles, just for fun. A wild and crazy pace He liked to race, Making it out alive …
A translator was quite swift and fast, He went running to reach the first class. He ran with a light breeze, And achieved his degrees, With …
A graphic designer had a hunch To go for a run with a punch So off she went in a trot In a bright neon jogging top This designer had a lot …
A clown was out running one day, He just had to get away. He ran so far and fast, That his shoes were worn past. So he stopped to get a new …
An architect who ran with the greatest of ease, He could travel for miles and fortease. Though a pro he did lack, For he was so out of …
A farmer was running about, With determination and no doubt, The wind in his face, His heart kept the pace, For the race had no end to run …
A daring race car driver who ran Across the track like a fast-moving fan In a blur of speed and tire smoke He easily earned his acclaim and …
There once was a travel agent named Todd Who, to stay fit, took up running like a god His commitment was great And his speed quite first …
A medical that’s running so swift, Around the hospital he drifts, With speed that’s unmeasured, A cool feat he’s treasured, To heal the sick …
A lecturer who loved to run and race Found he was best in his place Gave speeches with haste Then sped off in a haste Always winning first …
There was a musician who had quite a run, For miles and miles he was on the run, He played as he moved, His beats improved, His music was …
A biologist who was ever so keen Began to jog by a nearby stream Though the task was hard She ran in the yard Like a pro, so her passion …
A lecturer so quick on her feet, Her running made others look weak. She’d go ‘round and ‘round, Without ever a sound, Her speed was quite a …
A pharmacist who loved to go running Would hit the track with a fervor that’s stunning Each morning he’d race At a surprisingly fast pace …
A florist who loved to run fast To catch the sun’s light, he aghast His feet flew on the path No more than a wrath As he ran through the …
A florist who loved to go running Gave her shop a break and kept on gunning From morning to night Through the streets in her flight Her …
A speedy swimmer who could run Though he moved fast he had fun As he bolted like a deer He was quite a sight to cheer For no one else could …
A publisher who was always on the run, Found her schedule was way too much fun. She’d dash off and dash back, In her stylish track-pack, …
There once was an inventor named Joe Who was running around quite slow It was not his aim But he did the same With hopes of some success to …
A journalist who had quite a knack For running decided to attack The track with her speed Her performance they’d heed For it was quite a …
A pharmacist named Joe was quite fleet On the track he was quite hard to beat In running he’d soar Without ever a chore And Joe was the one …
A biologist found herself running, To test her theory, time was stunting. For her experiment’s sake, It had to be a stake, And results were …
A pilot so brave and adoring Was running to make her world more exploring The sun shone so bright And gave her delight To keep on running, …
A hairdresser was fond of running, And did it with hardly a yawning; She ran so fast That she felt aghast, It was her best morning-work …
A daring fisherman named Paul Had the strangest of habits of all For running he’d go With his rod in tow In the hopes of catching a haul.
